H0.text: Predators are organisms in an ecosystem that capture and kill other animals for food, such as lions.

H1.text: Hunters are organisms in an ecosystem that capture and kill other animals for food.

H2.text: Alphas are organisms in an ecosystem that capture and kill other animals for food, such as lions.

H3.text: Leaders are organisms, such as lions, that capture and kill other animals for food in an ecosystem.

A4.text: Predators are organisms that kill and eat other organisms.

A5.text: Micropredators typically do not kill their hosts.

A6.text: Predators are often highly specialized in their diet and hunting behaviour; for example, the Eurasian lynx only hunts small ungulates.

A7.text: Many predators are powerfully built and can catch and kill animals larger than themselves; this applies as much to small predators such as ants and shrews as to big and visibly muscular carnivores like the cougar and lion.
